title: Quiz 3: Decontamination & Safety Procedures
description: Focuses on instrument processing, chemical agents, and sharp safety.

questions.question: Which of the following is defined as a chemical agent used to kill micro-organisms on INANIMATE objects?
questions.explanation: Disinfectants are for inanimate objects (instruments, surfaces), while antiseptics are for living tissue.

questions.question: To make instruments safe for handling (decontamination), they should be soaked in ___BLANK___ percent chlorine for ___BLANK___ minutes.
questions.explanation: The standard for decontamination is 0.5% chlorine for 10 minutes.
questions.hint: Think of the standard 'Jik' soak time.

questions.question: Match the chemical agent to its category:

richContent.content:
AgentUsage
IodineSkin
GlutaraldehydeInstruments

questions.explanation: Savlon is an antiseptic; Cidex and Chlorine are high-level disinfectants; Phenols are low-level.
questions.hint: Which one acts on skin vs. instruments?

questions.question: Arrange the steps for processing instruments in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Always decontaminate first to make items safe to touch, then clean, then sterilize.
questions.hint: Make it safe -> Make it clean -> Kill everything.

questions.question: Which of the following are safe practices for handling sharps? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Bend needles before disposal to prevent reuse

questions.explanation: Never bend, break, or recap needles manually. Use puncture-resistant containers and hands-free transfer.

questions.question: When disposing of a sharps container, it should be disposed of by incineration when it is ___BLANK___ full.
questions.explanation: Sharps containers should be closed and disposed of when they are 3/4 full to prevent overfilling injuries.

questions.question: Antiseptics should be used to disinfect inanimate objects like surgical instruments.
questions.explanation: Antiseptics are for living tissue. Disinfectants are for inanimate objects.

questions.question: What is the 'hands-free' technique in passing sharps?

options.text: Throwing the instrument to the colleague
Placing the sharp in a 'safe zone' container for the colleague to pick up
Handing it over while wearing heavy gloves
Caping the needle before handing it over

questions.explanation: The hands-free technique involves placing the instrument in a neutral zone (kidney dish) to avoid hand-to-hand transfer injuries.

questions.question: Ideally, how should a home environment be arranged for aseptic procedures?

options.text: Separate corners for clean procedures/sterile items and dirty items/decontamination
Procedures should be done on the floor
It does not matter in a home setting

questions.explanation: Separating clean/sterile areas from dirty/decontamination areas minimizes cross-contamination.

questions.question: Rinsing soiled items in ___BLANK___ water is recommended before further processing because hot water coagulates protein.
questions.explanation: Cold water is used initially to rinse soiled items because hot water sets (coagulates) proteins like blood, making them harder to remove.
questions.hint: Temperature of water for blood removal.
